p: It could have, because this is already the seventh coronavirus to try to make itself at home within the human population [ 2]. It is trying to adapt to us and use us as its reservoir. Specifically, we exist together with this virus on a small blue-brown planet in a vast dark universe. We share it with tens of millions of other species. They all strive to barely survive. More than 99%of all species that have ever existed on Earth have failed to survive to this day [ 1]. That is why viruses constantly transfer themselves to new species and thus expand their reservoirs. They must choose the winning species because they cannot reproduce on their own. Their survival depends on the survival of the species that is their reservoir [ 3].
